scraper.base

Class WebScraper

  • java.lang.Object
    • scraper.base.WebScraper

  • public class WebScraper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a simple mechanism to crawl a series of webpages recursively and extract all of the images that are found on the pages visited.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebScraper(java.lang.String urlIn)
      Builds a new WebScraper that should start at the provided URL and will by default explore that page at a depth of 0.
      WebScraper(java.lang.String urlIn, int depthIn)
      Builds a new WebScraper that should start at the provided URL and will explore recursively to a specified depth.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebScraper

        public WebScraper(java.lang.String urlIn)
        Builds a new WebScraper that should start at the provided URL and will by default explore that page at a depth of 0. This allows extracting just the details from this page and nothing else.
        Parameters:
        urlIn - The URL to explore for images.

      • WebScraper

        public WebScraper(java.lang.String urlIn,
                  int depthIn)
        Builds a new WebScraper that should start at the provided URL and will explore recursively to a specified depth.
        Parameters:
        urlIn - The URL to begin exploring for images.
        depthIn - The recursive depth to explore, must be >= 0. Negative values will be treated as equivalent to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • setDepth

        public void setDepth(int depthIn)
        Updates this WebScraper to explore to a new depth.
        Parameters:
        depthIn - The recursive depth to explore, must be >= 0. Negative values will be treated as equivalent to 0.

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Retrieves the exploration depth of this WebScraper.
        Returns:
        The depth stored in this WebScraper.

      • setURL

        public void setURL(java.lang.String url)
        Updates the base URL to explore for this WebScraper.
        Parameters:
        url - The new URL to explore. The WebScraper url is only changed if the url value is valid (not null or empty).

      • getURL

        public java.lang.String getURL()
        Retrieves the base url for exploration by this WebScraper.
        Returns:
        The base url.

      • getImages

        public scraper.utils.ResultSet getImages()
        Retrieves the set of images found directly at the initial base URL for this WebScraper. This method will not explore any links found at the base page. Image information should be stored in the order in which their corresponding <img> tags appear in the source HTML code. If an image appears more than once in a page, only one entry should appear in the ResultSet.
        Returns:
        A collection of ImageEntry objects for the images found at the base url location.

      • crawlPage

        public scraper.utils.ResultSet crawlPage()
        This method will recursively explore pages starting at the base url defined for this WebScraper to the depth for which the scraper is configured.

        The ResultSet will contain all images discovered along the way, with images from a page being explored stored in the ResultSet prior to any images found on linked pages. ImageEntries will always appear in the ResultSet in the order in which the corresponding <img> tags are given in the HTML files. Only the first occurrence of a particular image (by absolute URL) is stored in the ResultSet.

        Links on a page will be explored in the sequential order in which their corresponding <a> tags appear in the HTML file. The same URL should never be crawled more than once, even if it is linked from itself or another later page.

        Returns:
        The set of ImageEntry objects resulting from this recursive crawl.

      • getPageHistory

        public scraper.utils.PageHistory getPageHistory()
        Retrieves the historical trail of pages visited during the last top-level call to crawlPage.
        Returns:
        The most recent collection of pages visited. If the crawlPage method has not been previously called, the PageHistory object will be empty.
